intro: [WRONG START] Rubus vulgarus var. micranthus, commonly known as the common blackberry. It is a shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a dark purple or black color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, fertile ground. This variety is often cultivated for its edible berries and ornamental value.
